column4: hey guys, I finally got around to doing a clean reinstall of Hoary. Why is there no more XMMS?
wiki.ubuntu.com/SynapticHowto
it's in the universe repository
I've got universe up, or at least Synaptic SAYS I do :P
did you update?
yes
Note that the how2 is for the old synaptic - this new one seems buggy to me.
well, it's there, I don't know what might be broken in your config
well according to apt it isn't, lol
paste your /etc/apt/sources.list to #flood
dude
00:10:44           bob2 | Aron: paste your /etc/apt/sources.list to #flood
sudo apt-get update, then paste the output of "apt-cache policy xmms" to #flood
everything's up in #flood
it won't work on any operating system
unless it's a mac
By "any OS" you mean any Debian-based? Because it worked in Suse.
suse doesn't automount it when you insert it
It does when you attempt to access the disk, at least in 9.1
A floppy drive wouldn't be detected by Ubuntu installation? o.o
standard amd64 kernel, and gimme a sec
er
that just says where to mount it
